info.title: Innosoft ReST API
info.description:
This is the technical specification of the Innosoft ReST API.
For general explanations, guides and other documentation see [here](https://innosoft.de).

---
## General notes
* You can download this OpenAPI spec (fka Swagger) as [OAS3.0](https://innosoft.de) or [OAS2.0](https://innosoft.de) file. It can be used for tooling like code generation.
* Some fields may require a reference value to an Innosoft database field. The reference target will be shown in capital letters with the syntax `TABLENAME.COLUMNNAME`.
* If not further described, the type `integer` shall be interpreted as 32 bit integer.
* If not further described, ID properties in the request body will be ignored, if they are already present in the URL (as path parameters).
* Retrieving lists of resource references will only contain items you have read access to.

tags.name: Addresses
tags.description: Generalized operations for debtors and locations.

tags.name: Addresses\Assignments
tags.description: Address assignments are used for the delegation of tasks and the allocation of resources to an address.

tags.name: Addresses\Contact persons
tags.description: Contact persons of a specific address.

tags.name: Assignments
tags.description: Generalized operations for absent-, address-, internal- and project assignments.

tags.name: Contact persons
tags.description: Individuals that represent an organization.

tags.name: Debtors
tags.description: Debtors represent organizational entities which can handle the financial activities.

tags.name: Direct Database Access
tags.description: Low level functionality for working with database tables.

tags.name: Documents
tags.description: A document is a description (metadata) of a file that can be attached to certain domain objects. The file itself is not a part of a document.

tags.name: Documents\Attachments
tags.description: An attachment represents the link between a document and other resources, such as projects and machines.

tags.name: Invoicable Service Reports
tags.description: Service reports that are available for invoicing. They contain information about working times,  cash expenses and materials for a given assignment.

tags.name: Locations
tags.description: Locations represent the hierarchical structure of organizations.

tags.name: Machines
tags.description: Machines can be representations of physical machines or machine parts.

tags.name: Projects
tags.description: Projects represent data for the planning of services in your company.

tags.name: Projects\Assignments
tags.description: Project assignments are used for the delegation of tasks and the allocation of resources to a project or an order.

tags.name: Projects\Assignments\Machines
tags.description: Assignment machines are links between existing machines and a project assignment.

tags.name: Projects\Contact persons
tags.description: Project contact persons are links between existing contact persons and a project.

tags.name: Projects\Machines
tags.description: Project machines are links between existing machines and a project.

tags.name: Projects\Materials
tags.description: Project materials are links between existing materials and a project.

tags.name: Resources\Absent assignments
tags.description: Absent assignments represent periods when a resource is not available for other assignments.

tags.name: Resources\Internal assignments
tags.description: Internal assignments are used for the delegation of internal tasks which do not belong to a project or an address.

tags.name: Spare parts
tags.description: Spare parts include all materials that can be used to carry out assignments.

tags.name: Tickets
tags.description: Tickets are used to capture, assign and resolve issues.

tags.name: Tickets\Texts
tags.description: Internal-, solution- and issuetexts of a ticket.

post.description: Execute a dynamic search for locations and debtors at once, as both resource types share the same basic properties.

requestBody.description: A list of range entries to specify the search criterias.

201.description: The search has been executed successfully.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error codes are:
* ADS-C-0001 | The referenced field does not exist in the entities you are searching for.
* ADS-C-0002 | Invalid operation.
* ADS-C-0003 | Invalid mode.
* ADS-C-0004 | Value in *low* is not valid (wrong data type).
* ADS-C-0005 | Value in *high* is not valid (wrong data type).
* ADS-C-1000 | Malformed JSON content.
* ADS-C-1001 | No content provided in the body of the request.

example.message: Invalid mode.

403.description:
Forbidden. Possible error codes are:
* ADS-C-0000 | You have insufficient permissions to search for addresses.

example.message: You have insufficient permissions to search for addresses.

get.summary: List all contact persons for an address.
get.description: Retrieve an object with a collection of resource references to all contact persons of a  specific address (which can be a debtor or a location).

403.description:
Forbidden. Possible error codes are:
* COP-A-0000 | You have insufficient permissions to read contact persons.

example.message: You either have insufficient permissions to read contact persons or reading is disabled in general.

404.description:
Not found. Possible error codes are:
* COP-A-0005 | The address which is referenced in the URL does not exist.

example.message: The address which is referenced in the URL does not exist.

get.summary: List all assignments for an address.
get.description:
Retrieve references to all assignments of a specific address.

You can use optional query parameters to filter by a specific time frame. Examples:
* /api/addresses/42/assignments?since=2015-10-16
* /api/addresses/42/assignments?until=2015-12-31T23:59:59
* /api/addresses/42/assignments?since=2015-10-16&until=2015-10-31

**Note:** Timezones are not supported, so the time should be converted to the local timezone of the database server first.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Optional filter "since" in the format YYYY-MM-DD[Thh:mm:ss]. Matches the property *begin*.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: Optional filter "until" in the format YYYY-MM-DD[Thh:mm:ss]. Matches the property *end*.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error codes are:
* AAS-A-0017 | One of the date parameters in the URL is outside of the supported range ('1753-01-01' - '9999-12-31T23:59:59').
* AAS-A-1002 | One of the date parameters could not be parsed, because the format is invalid or the date itself does not exist.

example.message: "2015-06-31" is not a valid date.

403.description:
Forbidden. Possible error codes are:
* AAS-A-0000 | You have insufficient permissions to read assignments.

example.message: You have insufficient permissions to read assignments.

404.description:
Not Found. Possible error codes are:
* AAS-A-0005 | A referenced entity could not be found.

example.message: The address "49" does not exist.

post.description: Submit a new address assignment to Innosoft. Omit fields marked as readOnly. The response will contain the generated values.

requestBody.description: The assignment resource that will be added to Innosoft. The field *addressId* will be ignored as the path parameter is leading.

201.description: The address assignment has been created successfully.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error codes are:
* AAS-C-0002 | A mandatory field is missing.
* AAS-C-0003 | An assignment with the given id already exists.
* AAS-C-0005 | A referenced entity could not be found.
* AAS-C-0006 | At least one field has exceeded the allowed character length.
* AAS-C-0007 | The referenced code exists but is invalid for an address assignment.
* AAS-C-0009 | The referenced entity is invalid.
* AAS-C-0010 | The referenced entity is inactive.
* AAS-C-0015 | The status of the address is inactive.
* AAS-C-0016 | A DateTime property has invalid values (i.e. month = 0 or minute = 60).
* AAS-C-0017 | A DateTime property is outside of the allowed range (i.e. year = 1752).
* AAS-C-0018 | The time frame between begin and end is less than 15 minutes or the DateTime which marks the end of the time frame is before the begin.
* AAS-C-1000 | Malformed JSON content.
* AAS-C-1001 | No content provided in the body of the request.

example.message: The property 'remark' cannot have more than 33 characters.

403.description:
Forbidden. Possible error codes are:
* AAS-C-0000 | You have insufficient permissions to create assignments in general or you do not have write access  to the group and main group of the assignment or the referenced resource. This error code is also possible if you  try to set the *statusId* and do not have the right to edit the status of an assignment.

example.message: You have insufficient permissions to create address assignments.

404.description:
Not Found. Possible error codes are:
* AAS-C-0005 | A referenced entity could not be found.

example.message: The address "49" does not exist.

500.description:
Internal Server Error. Known error codes are:
* AAS-C-0001 | The number range is exceeded.

example.message: The number range is exceeded.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of an address assignment.

get.summary: Get address assignment by id.
get.description: Retrieve the data of a single assignment by its id.

parameters.name: toUTC
parameters.description:
If you want to get the ExtendedDateTime properties of the assignment in UTC you can add this query parameter. For example:
* /api/addresses/47/assignments/3?toUTC=true

403.description:
Forbidden. Possible error codes are:
* AAS-R-0000 | You have insufficient permissions to read assignments in general or you do not have the right  to access the group and main group of the assignment or the resource referenced by the assignment.

example.message: You have insufficient permissions to read assignments.

404.description:
Not Found. Possible error codes are:
* AAS-R-0005 | A referenced entity could not be found.

example.message: The address "49" does not exist.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Possible if a general error has occurred or if the assignment could be found in the database  but has invalid data. This is possible if the data was written by another system which has less validation rules.  Please check the protocol file of the server for more information.

put.summary: Create or update an address assignment.
put.description: Update an address assignment resource if it already exists. Otherwise it will be created.

requestBody.description: The address assignment resource. The properties *addressId* and *id* will be ignored as the path parameters are leading.

200.description: The address assignment has been updated successfully.

201.description: The address assignment has been created successfully.

400.description:
Bad Request.
Possible error codes for Update are:
* AAS-U-0002 | A mandatory field is missing.
* AAS-U-0005 | A referenced entity could not be found.
* AAS-U-0006 | At least one field has exceeded the allowed character length.
* AAS-U-0007 | The referenced code exists but is invalid for an address assignment.
* AAS-U-0009 | The referenced entity is invalid.
* AAS-U-0010 | The referenced entity is inactive.
* AAS-U-0015 | The status of the address is inactive.
* AAS-U-0016 | A DateTime property has invalid values (i.e. month = 0 or minute = 60).
* AAS-U-0017 | A DateTime property is outside of the allowed range (i.e. year = 1752).
* AAS-U-0018 | The time frame between begin and end is less than 15 minutes or the DateTime which marks the end of the time frame is before the begin.
* AAS-U-0019 | The status of the old state of the assignment does not allow editing. You can not edit the assignment unless you reference a status which allows editing again.
* AAS-U-1000 | Malformed JSON content.
* AAS-U-1001 | No content provided in the body of the request.

Possible error codes for Create are:
* AAS-C-0002 | A mandatory field is missing.
* AAS-C-0005 | A referenced entity could not be found.
* AAS-C-0006 | At least one field has exceeded the allowed character length.
* AAS-C-0007 | The referenced code exists but is invalid for an address assignment.
* AAS-C-0009 | The referenced entity is invalid.
* AAS-C-0010 | The referenced entity is inactive.
* AAS-C-0015 | The status of the address is inactive.
* AAS-C-0016 | A DateTime property has invalid values (i.e. month = 0 or minute = 60).
* AAS-C-0017 | A DateTime property is outside of the allowed range (i.e. year = 1752).
* AAS-C-0018 | The time frame between begin and end is less than 15 minutes or the DateTime which marks the end of the time frame is before the begin.
* AAS-C-1000 | Malformed JSON content.
* AAS-C-1001 | No content provided in the body of the request.

example.message: The property 'remark' cannot have more than 33 characters.

403.description:
Forbidden. Possible error codes are:
* AAS-U-0000 | You have insufficient permissions to update assignments in general or you do not have write  access to the group and main group of the assignment or the referenced resource. This also applies to the  old state of the assignment (i.e. you can not move an assignment from one resource to another if you have  no rights to edit the group of the old resource). This error code is also possible if you try to set the  statusId and do not have the right to edit the status of an assignment.
* AAS-C-0000 | You have insufficient permissions to create assignments in general or you do not have write  access to the group and main group of the assignment or the referenced resource. This error code is also  possible if you try to set the statusId and do not have the right to edit the status of an assignment.

example.message: You have insufficient permissions to update assignments.

404.description:
Not Found. Possible error codes are:
* AAS-C-0005 | A referenced entity could not be found.

example.message: The address "49" does not exist.

204.description: The address assignment has been deleted successfully.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error codes are:
* AAS-D-0001 | The assignment is already referenced by an other entity (i.e. service reports).
* AAS-D-0015 | The status of the address is inactive.

example.message: The status of the address is inactive.

403.description:
Forbidden. Possible error codes are:
* AAS-D-0000 | You have insufficient permissions to delete assignments in general or you do not have the right to access the group and main group of the assignment or the resource referenced by the assignment.

example.message: You have insufficient permissions to delete address assignments.

404.description:
Not Found. Possible error codes are:
* AAS-D-0005 | A referenced entity could not be found.

example.message: The address "49" does not exist.

post.summary: Change address of a contact person.
post.description: Reassign a contact person to another address. **Internally the contact person will be copied.** The old contact person will be set to inactive and the new contact person will be returned  in the response. You can do the same by doing a PUT request with the complete updated contact  person in the request body to /api/contactPersons/{id}.

requestBody.description: The address change resource which contains the necessary information for this operation.

contactPersonId.description: Unique identifier for the contact person u want to reassign to a new address.

newAddress.description: Reference to the *id* of the new address (location or debtor).

201.description: The address of the contact person has been changed successfully.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error codes are:
* CAC-C-0002 | A mandatory field is missing.
* CAC-C-0005 | A referenced entity could not be found.
* CAC-C-0006 | At least one field has exceeded the allowed character length.
* CAC-C-1000 | Malformed JSON content.
* CAC-C-1001 | No content provided in the body of the request.

example.message: The property 'newAddress' cannot have more than 20 characters.

403.description:
Forbidden. Possible error codes are:
* CAC-C-0000 | You have insufficient permissions to change the address of contact persons.

example.message: You have insufficient permissions to change the address of contact persons.

post.summary: Convert a debtor into a location.
post.description: In some cases you may need to convert a debtor into a location, which can be done by posting the desired location  object in the request body to this endpoint. The property *id* has to be a reference to the debtor you want to convert  into a location. You will also need to change the property *type* of the location in comparison to the old debtor  object, because address types are restricted to either locations or debtors.

requestBody.description: The desired location resource for the conversion. The *id* field has to be a reference to the id of the debtor  you want to convert into a location.

201.description: The debtor has been successfully converted into a location.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error codes are:
* DTL-C-0001 | The referenced debtor does not exist.
* DTL-C-0002 | A mandatory field is missing.
* DTL-C-0005 | A referenced entity could not be found.
* DTL-C-0006 | At least one field has exceeded the allowed character length.
* DTL-C-0007 | The referenced type exists but is invalid for a location.
* DTL-C-0022 | The referenced entity is not a debtor (it may be a location already).
* DTL-C-1000 | Malformed JSON content.
* DTL-C-1001 | No content provided in the body of the request.

example.message: The property 'matchCode' cannot have more than 33 characters.

403.description:
Forbidden. Possible error codes are:
* DTL-C-0000 | You have insufficient permissions to convert the debtor into a location.

example.message: You have insufficient permissions to convert the debtor into a location.

post.description:
The file transfer resource offers a method to generate an *unpublished* document which *fileUrl* refers a non existent 
file resource. The local file must be uploaded to the generated *fileUrl*. This method is used as a kind of preprocessing 
step before creating documents that refer a local file that hasn't got a *fileUrl* yet. The client creation scenario can 
be roughly divided into following steps:    
1. document = /api/documents/fileTransfer/requestFileUrl
2. upload local file to document.FileUrl (POST document.FileUrl)
3. create document (POST /api/documents/)

200.description: The project assignment has been updated successfully.

201.description: The project assignment has been created successfully.

400.description:
Bad Request.
Possible error codes for Update are:
* PAS-U-0002 | A mandatory field is missing.
* PAS-U-0005 | A referenced entity could not be found.
* PAS-U-0006 | At least one field has exceeded the allowed character length.
* PAS-U-0007 | The referenced code exists but is invalid for a project assignment.
* PAS-U-0009 | The referenced entity is invalid.
* PAS-U-0010 | The referenced entity is inactive.
* PAS-U-0013 | The referenced status is less restrictive than the status referenced by the project.
* PAS-U-0015 | The referenced status of the project disables the editing of assignments.
* PAS-U-0016 | A DateTime property has invalid values (i.e. month = 0 or minute = 60).
* PAS-U-0017 | A DateTime property is outside of the allowed range (i.e. year = 1752).
* PAS-U-0018 | The time frame between begin and end is less than 15 minutes or the DateTime which marks the end of the time frame is before the begin.
* PAS-U-1000 | Malformed JSON content.
* PAS-U-1001 | No content provided in the body of the request.

Possible error codes for Create are:
* PAS-C-0002 | A mandatory field is missing.
* PAS-C-0005 | A referenced entity could not be found.
* PAS-C-0006 | At least one field has exceeded the allowed character length.
* PAS-C-0007 | The referenced code exists but is invalid for a project assignment.

* PAS-C-0017 | A DateTime property is outside of the allowed range (i.e. year = 1752).
* PAS-C-0018 | The time frame between begin and end is less than 15 minutes or the DateTime which marks the end of the time frame is before the begin.

* PAS-C-0000 | You have insufficient permissions to create project assignments in general or you do not have write access to the group  and main group of the resource. This error code is also possible if you try to set the *statusId* and do not have the right to edit  the status of an assignment.

get.summary: Get assignments with duplicate erpTicket.
get.description: Retrieve all assignments, where the combination of *erpTicketNumber* and *erpOrderNumber* is not unique. You will only see assignments you have read access rights to, so you might get results which contain less than two assignments with the  same combination of *erpTicketNumber* and *erpOrderNumber* because some assignments from other main groups or groups might be excluded  in the result. The result only contains assignments where both *erpTicketNumber* and *erpOrderNumber* are not *null*. In contrast to other collection resources this resource does not contain links but the assignments themselves. In addition the assignments  might be invalid, because the validation is skipped to be able to use this resource for its primary purpose: to recognize assignments which  were copied in the Innosoft Resource Planning and are therefore unknown by a leading ERP system which imported the original assignments with  the ticket number as id.

403.description:
Forbidden. Possible error codes are:
* PAS-A-0000 | You have insufficient permissions to read assignments.

example.message: You have insufficient permissions to read assignments.

get.summary: List all absent assignments for a resource.
get.description:
Retrieve references to all absent assignments of a specific resource.

You can use optional query parameters to filter by a specific time frame. Examples:
* /api/resources/42/assignments/absent?since=2015-10-16
* /api/resources/42/assignments/absent?until=2015-12-31T23:59:59
* /api/resources/42/assignments/absent?since=2015-10-16&until=2015-10-31

**Note:** Timezones are not supported, so the time should be converted to the local timezone of the database server first.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Optional filter "since" in the format YYYY-MM-DD[Thh:mm:ss]. Matches the property *begin*.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: Optional filter "until" in the format YYYY-MM-DD[Thh:mm:ss]. Matches the property *end*.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error codes are:
* ABS-A-0017 | One of the date parameters in the URL is outside of the supported range ('1753-01-01' - '9999-12-31T23:59:59').
* ABS-A-1002 | One of the date parameters could not be parsed, because the format is invalid or the date itself does not exist.

example.message: "2015-06-31" is not a valid date.

403.description:
Forbidden. Possible error codes are:
* ABS-A-0000 | You have insufficient permissions to read absent assignments.

example.message: You have insufficient permissions to read absent assignments.

404.description:
Not Found. Possible error codes are:
* ABS-A-0005 | A referenced entity could not be found.

example.message: The resource "49" does not exist.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error codes are:
* ABS-C-0002 | A mandatory field is missing.
* ABS-C-0003 | An assignment with the given id already exists.
* ABS-C-0005 | A referenced entity could not be found.
* ABS-C-0006 | At least one field has exceeded the allowed character length.
* ABS-C-0007 | The referenced code exists but is invalid for an absent assignment.
* ABS-C-0009 | The referenced entity is invalid.

errorCode.description:
An error code which can be used to look up more information in this documentation.
The structure is **{objectType}-{actionType}-{errorNumber}**

message.description: Detailed error message which contains more information about the error like field names or information on how the request should be modified to be valid.

TimeZoneId.description: Contains a custom time zone id which indicates the local time zone of the client.

TimeInUTC.description: If set to *true* the provided values for the date and time are understood as UTC values. Because **Innosoft** converts  these values back into the local time of the client the property *TimeZoneId* is mandatory if *TimeInUTC* is set to *true*. If set to *false* or *null* the values are not converted and the object behaves as if it was a normal DateTime object.

url.description: Complete URL of the target resource.

isValid.description: If this property is set to false the target resource is invalid (e.g. mandatory fields missing).

default.description:
Default translation. The allowed string length can vary between different resources.
This field is mandatory under two circumstances:

* At least on language translation has been specified.
* The field on the owning object is a translation type and is mandatory.

translations.description: Dynamic object/dictionary with elements consisting of a string key and a string value. The key is either a predefined language key or the Innosoft language id.

additionalProperties.description: The translation value for the respective language key. The length of the values can vary between different resources, but should generally be the same as the length of the default value.

mode.description:
Can be used to include or exclude the respective results. Possible values are:
* I = Inclusive. The results of the search should only contain entities which fulfill the criteria.
* E = Exclusive. The results of the search should only contain entities which do **not** fulfill the criteria.

operation.description:
The operation that defines the meaning of the fields **low** and **high** in relation the the field defined by fieldname.
Possible values are:
* Eq = Equals the value of *low*. *High* will be ignored.
* Lt = Lesser than the value of *low*. *High* will be ignored.
* Gt = Greater than the value of *low*. *High* will be ignored.
* Bt = Between the values of *high* and *low*. The values of *high* and *low* are **included** in the range.

fieldname.description: Name of a field of the resource you want to use for this range entry (e.g. "type" or "address.street").

low.description: Depending on the specified *operation* and *mode* this property defines the first search parameter/value.

high.description: Only required for the operation *Bt* (Between). Same restrictions as *low*.

id.description: The Unique identifier for the location.

zipCode.description: Postal zip code of the location.

countryCodeId.description: ISO code for the country (i.e. "DE" for Germany). This property references the database field SPESEN.LANDKF.

latitude.description: The floating-point number of the latitude angle.

longitude.description: The floating point number of the longitude angle.

mainGroupId.description: Reference to the database field OPTION_O.OGRNR.

languageId.description:
One of the Innosoft language ids:
* 0 = German
* 1 = English
* 2 = Dutch
* 3 = French
* 4 = Spanish
* 5 = Italian
* 6 = Danish
* 7 = Polish
* 8 = Czech
* 9 = Russian
* 10 = Portuguese
* 11 = Chinese
* 12 = Japanese
* 13 = Argentinean
* 14 = Portuguese (Brazil)
* 15 = Korean

parentId.description: Id of the superior address (location or debtor).

statusId.description: A number representing the status of the location (i.e. 0 for active and 1 for inactive).

timeZoneId.description: Reference to a time zone (TIMEZONES.TZID). Can be ommitted if you provide an *externalTimeZoneId*.

externalTimeZoneId.description: The external id of the timezone. If set the value of timeZoneId will be ignored.

poBox.title: PoBox

number.description: The number of the post office box.

zipCode.description: The postal zip code of the post office.

bank.title: Bank
bank.description: An object which exposes bank related information.

clientId.description: The id of the client (debtor) at the specified bank.

vatRateId.description: The identifier for the rate used in the VAT calculation. Reference to the database field NMWST.MWSTKZ.

taxId.description: Reference to a unique tax registration number (VKUNZUS.USTID).

termsOfPaymentId.description: Reference to the database field ZAHLUNG.ZNR.

invoiceCurrencyId.description: Reference to the database field CUFAKTOR.CURRENCY.

billingId.description:
One of the Innosoft billing ids. Please note that the meaning of each code can be overwritten in your instance 
of the Innosoft system but the default values are:
* 0 = Bill after expenses
* 1 = Fixed price
* 2 = Bill after expenses up to a maximum
* 3 = Invoice for a sales order

id.description: The Unique identifier for the machine.

externalId.description: Commonly used to store serial numbers or ids of external systems.

locationId.description: Reference to the *id* of the machine location (location or debtor).

typeId.description: Can be used to define the type of the machine. If provided, the referenced type must exist (MASCHTYP.MASCHTYP).

statusId.description: A number representing the status of the machine (i.e. 0 for active and 1 for inactive).

id.description: Internal id of the spare part. Not displayed in the UI of the Resource Planning so  please use the *partNumber* for the official number.

partNumber.description: Official part number for this spare part.

allOf.description: Default value and translations for the name. Maximum 170 characters per translation. At least the default translation is mandatory.
Default value and translation for the description. No maximum character limitation.
Default value and translations for the unit name (e.g. "pieces", "liter", "meter", "cubic meter"). Maximum 6 characters per translation

mainGroupId.description: Reference to the database field OPTION_O.OGRNR.

statusId.description: A number representing the status of the spare part (i.e. 0 for active and 1 for inactive).

level.description: A new ticket starts with the level 1. Each forward will result in a new level, leaving the old ones locked for history purposes. Only the highest level can be edited until it is being closed.

typeId.description: Reference to the type of the ticket. This property references the field PKEY from the Innosoft table PROKEY.

processingStatusId.description: Internal ticket status. You can change it indirectly via the respective actions like close, forward, or reopen.

displayStatusId.description:
Reference to the display status (PROSTATUS.PROSTATUSKEY).

---
**Note:** This status does not affect logic like the **processingStatusId** does. Take the following example: If you define a display status "closed" and set the ticket to it, it will still be editable until you explicitly call close.

---

hotliner.description: Login name of the currently responsible person (PWUSER.NAME). Can be omitted if you provide a groupId. If neither of the two are provided, the ReST-Api user will be taken as hotliner. Providing both will result in an error.

groupId.description: Id of the currently responsible group (OPTION_G.GRNR). Can be omitted if you provide a hotliner. If neither of the two are provided, the ReST-Api user will be taken as hotliner. Providing both will result in an error.

allOf.description: Date until the ticket should be resolved.
Read-only time stamp of when the ticket level started.
Read-only time stamp of when the ticket level ended.

urgency.description: A number that indicates the priority of the ticket.

machineId.description: This field lets you assign a machine to the ticket (MAPARK.MASCHNR).

user.description: Login name of the person who wrote the text (PWUSER.NAME).

allOf.description: Read-only UTC time stamp of when the text was written or changed.

id.description: The Unique identifier for the project.

externalId.description: Can be used as identifier from an external system.

locationId.description: Reference to the id of the address (location or debtor) where the project will take place. Can be omitted if you also provide a machine with a valid location by posting a CompositeProject.

ordererId.description:
Reference to the id of a location or a debtor.
**Default:** the same value as the locationId (also if the locationId is copied from a machine).

debtorId.description:
Reference to the id of a debtor which will be useful for financial activities during the project.

**Default:** the same value as the locationId or a parent of the referenced address in locationId. The value depends on the type of the referenced address. If the address is a debtor the id of this debtor is used. If the address is a location the server will try to find the first debtor in the address hierarchy of the location.

The debtor validation can be reduced to a mere existence check, by setting a flag in the database field OPTIONEN_E.OPTIONEN (The 25th bit has to be '0').

orderTypeId.description:
Reference to the type of the order which led to this project (AUART.AUART).
Default: reference to the first entry in the table AUART or 0 if the table is empty.

statusId.description:
Reference to the database field AUSTATUS.NR.

**Default:** If there is an entry with beschreibung = 1 in the Innosoft table FELDINHALT for GRUPPE = 9 and ZAEHLER = 567 the content of the field BESCHREIBUNG converted to an integer.

If this is not successful or if there is no entry the default value will be the first entry from the table AUSTATUS ordered by NR.

mainGroupId.description: Reference to the database field OPTION_O.OGRNR.

codeId.description:
Code for the classification of the project (OPTION_K.KNR).
The field TYP of the referenced code has to be 5 or 6.

invoicingCodeId.description: One of the following invoicing codes: * 0 = Standard invoicing * 3 = Collective project (partial order) * 4 = Collective project (complete order)

allOf.description: Complex object for financial numbers and references. The values for each property of the debtorInfo will be copied from the debtor referenced by debtorId if it is null in the request.

activityTypeId.description:
Identifier for one of the Innosoft activity types:

**Working:**
* NOR = normal
* U25 = first overtime category
* U30 = on Saturdays
* U50 = second overtime category
* U5N = at night
* USO = on Sundays
* UFT = on a holiday
* UFH = on a special/high holiday
* TAG = whole day if a daily rate is used

**Driving:**
* F25 = first overtime category
* F30 = on Saturdays
* F50 = second overtime category
* F5N = at night
* FSO = on Sundays
* FFT = on a holday
* FFH = on a special/high holdiay

**Special:**
* FH = trip home to the family
* SA = stint compensation
* U6N = additional overtime category
* U7N = additional overtime category
* WA = idle time
* WEG = intermediate trip (e.g. workplace to hotel)

resource.title: Resource
resource.description:
Reference to an **Innosoft** resource (i.e. a technician or a utility vehicle).

**Please note**, that you must have permissions for the group and the main group of the resource. If you want to  move an absent assignment from one resource to another you need write permissions for the old group and main group  as well as the new group and main group of the destination resource.

id.description: Reference to the database field RESSLIST.RESSNR.

immutable.description: Defines, whether the resource can be changed in the graphical overview of the Innosoft Resource Planning.

codeId.description:
Code for the classification of the assignment. Reference to the database field OPTION_K.KNR.
(Remark: The value for the field *TYP* of the referenced entry in the OPTION_K table must be 1 or 2.)

allOf.description:
Begin of the absent period.

(Remark: If you set the properties for hour, minute and second to *null* in the request  the time will default to the database field OPTION_E.ARBEITSBEGINN)

End of the absent period.

**Attention:** The difference between begin and end must be **at least 15 minutes**.  Smaller periods are not supported by the Innosoft system.

(Remark: If you set the properties for hour, minute and second to *null* in the request  the time will default to the database field OPTION_E.ARBEITSENDE)

Can be ignored (exists because of technical reasons in order to handle all assignments uniformly).

**Default:** same value as *begin*.

Can be ignored (exists because of technical reasons in order to handle all assignments uniformly).

**Default:** same value as *end*.

beginImmutable.description: Marks if the *begin* can not be changed accidentally in the graphical overview of the Innosoft Resource Planning.

endImmutable.description: Marks if the *end* can not be changed accidentally in the graphical overview of the Innosoft Resource Planning.

allOf.description: Values for this field will be ignored by PUT and POST requests. When the assignment is initially  created *originalBegin* receives its values from the *begin* property.Therefore this property is  **readonly** and is used to keep track of the planned begin.

Values for this field will be ignored by PUT and POST requests. When the assignment is initially  created *originalEnd* receives its values from the *end* property. Therefore this property is  **readonly** and is used to keep track of the planned end.

sendStatusId.description:
Reference to one of the default Innosoft send status ids:
* 0 = Undefined
* 1 = To be sent
* 2 = Sent
* 3 = Received

There can also be custom ids for the *sendStatusId* which have to be defined in Innosoft first. The custom ids 
can be referenced as well. They are saved in the table FELDINHALT (GRUPPE = 1).

remark.description: Short description for the absent assignment.

* 1 = external

id.description: The identifier for the assignment.

resource.title: Resource
resource.description:
Reference to an **Innosoft** resource (i.e. a technician or a utility vehicle). This property is mostly used to  delegate work to a technician. Can be omitted if you provide a *groupId*.

**Please note**, that you must have permissions for the group and the main group of the *resource*. If you want to  move an assignment from one resource to another you need write permissions for the old group and main group  as well as the new group and main group of the destination resource.

id.description: Reference to the database field RESSLIST.RESSNR.

immutable.description: Defines, whether the resource can be changed in the graphical overview of the Innosoft Resource Planning.

addressId.description: Reference to the *id* of an address (location or debtor).

codeId.description:
Code for the classification of the assignment. Reference to the database field OPTION_K.KNR.
(Remark: The value for the field *TYP* of the referenced entry in the OPTION_K table must be 1 or 2.)

allOf.description:
Begin of the assignment. This property is often used to mark the moment when a technician has to  start traveling to a site.

(Remark: If you set the properties for hour, minute and second to *null* in the request  the time will default to the database field OPTION_E.ARBEITSBEGINN)

End of the assignment. This property is often used to mark the moment when a technician has  finished the return trip from a site.

**Attention:** The difference between begin and end must be **at least 15 minutes**.  Smaller periods are not supported by the Innosoft system.

(Remark: If you set the properties for hour, minute and second to *null* in the request  the time will default to the database field OPTION_E.ARBEITSENDE)

Begin of work for an assignment. Has to lie in the interval *begin* and *end* of the assignment.

**Default:** same value as *begin*.

End of work for an assignment. Has to lie in the interval *begin* and *end* of the assignment.

**Default:** same value as *end*.

beginImmutable.description: Marks if the *begin* and the *begin of work* can not be changed accidentally in the graphical overview  of the Innosoft Resource Planning.

endImmutable.description: Marks if the *end* and the *end of work* can not be changed accidentally in the graphical overview  of the Innosoft Resource Planning.

allOf.description: Values for this field will be ignored by PUT and POST requests. When the assignment is initially  created *originalBegin* receives its values from the *begin* property.Therefore this property is  **readonly** and is used to keep track of the planned begin.

Values for this field will be ignored by PUT and POST requests. When the assignment is initially  created *originalEnd* receives its values from the *end* property. Therefore this property is  **readonly** and is used to keep track of the planned end.

mainGroupId.description:
Reference to the database field OPTION_O.OGRNR.

**Default:** if a resource is provided and the value of this property is *null* the *mainGroupId* 
of the resource will be used. Otherwise the value remains *null*.

Please note that that the authenticated user needs permissions for this main group. If you move the 
assignment from one main group to another you will need write permissions for the new *mainGroupId* 
as well as the old one.

groupId.description:
Reference to the database field OPTION_G.GRNR.

Can be omitted if you provide a *resource* with id. If you do not provide a *resource* this assignment 
is marked as a container assignment, meaning that it is only allocated to a specific group (and optional 
a main group). This function is often used to plan an assignment in advance without knowing who will 
accomplish the work.

**Default:** if a resource is provided and the value of this property is *null* the *groupId* of the 
resource will be copied.

Please note that you must have permissions for this group. If you move the assignment from one group to 
another you will need write permissions for the new *groupId* as well as the old one.

sendStatusId.description:
Reference to one of the default Innosoft send status ids:
* 0 = Undefined
* 1 = To be sent
* 2 = Sent
* 3 = Received

There can also be custom ids for the *sendStatusId* which have to be defined in Innosoft first. The custom ids 
can be referenced as well. They are saved in the table FELDINHALT (GRUPPE = 1).

planned.description: Marks an assignment as planned which leads to a different color in the Innosoft Resource Planning.

keyword.description: The value for keyword will be copied from the value of the code, that is referenced by the *codeId* Field.  Keyword is language specific for the user, who is currently authenticated for the request.

remark.description: Short description what has to be done.

description.description: Long description of the assignment. Can be used to elaborate the remark.

statusId.description:
Reference to the database field AUSTATUS.NR. You can only set this property if you have a right to edit the status of assignments  (stored in PWUSER.PRIVFA at the index 25 (beginning from 0)). You can not create or edit an assignment if the address it belongs to is inactive.

Additional information: When you create a new assignment you can reference a status which marks the assignment  as closed for editing. However if you want to edit an already closed assignment you can not reference a closed  status in the request. If you want to change some properties of a closed assignment you have to reopen it  (you can change other properties in the same request) and close it again in a second request.

* 0 = internal
* 1 = external

* 1 = work at Saturday and Sunday
* 2 = work at Saturday
* 3 = work at Sunday
* 4 = half day work at Saturday

Reference to the database field OPTION_O.OGRNR.

Reference to the database field OPTION_G.GRNR.

Can be omitted if you provide a *resource* with id. If you do not provide a *resource* this assignment 
is marked as a container assignment, meaning that it is only allocated to a specific group (and optional 
a main group). This function is often used to plan an assignment in advance without knowing who will 
accomplish the work.

**Default:** if a resource is provided and the value of this property is *null* the *groupId* of the 
resource will be copied.

Please note that you must have permissions for this group. If you move the assignment from one group to

sendStatusId.description:

* 0 = Undefined
* 1 = To be sent
* 2 = Sent

There can also be custom ids for the *sendStatusId* which have to be defined in Innosoft first. The custom ids

planned.description: Marks an assignment as planned which leads to a different color in the Innosoft Resource Planning.  This is often used to show that it is not clarified if the assignment will be exactly in the given  period of time or if the assignment is needed at all.

keyword.description: Will be copied from the project when the assignment is created.

remark.description: Short hint what has to be done.

description.description: Long description of the assignment. Can be used to elaborate the remark.

statusId.description:
Reference to the database field AUSTATUS.NR. You can only set this property if you have a right to edit the status of assignments  (stored in PWUSER.PRIVFA at the index 25 (beginning from 0)).

You can not reference a status which is less restrictive than the status of the project. I.e. if the status  of the project does not allow the editing of service reports you can not reference a status in the assignment which would allow it.

You can not create or edit an assignment if the project it belongs to does not allow the creation or the editing  of assignments anymore.

When you create a new assignment you can reference a status which marks the assignment as closed for editing.  However if you want to edit an already closed assignment you can not reference a closed status in the request.  If you just want to change some properties of a closed assignment you have to reopen it (you can change other  properties in the same request) and close it again in a second request.

id.description: Unique identifier of the document.

fileName.description:
Filename containing file extension (e.g. "picture.png").

Only mandatory if FileLocation.FileUrl refers to a file server resource.

locationId.description: Only mandatory if FileLocation.FileUrl refers to a file server resource.

fileUrl.description: URL to the file content resource (HTTP-GET to receive the content bytes).

tags.description: Search tags.

externalId.description: Id the document is associated with in a third-party system.

checksumHex.description: SHA1 checksum of the content bytes represented as hex string.

contentType.description:
Content type of the associated file (e.g. "application/pdf"). Should be compatible with the file  extension (e.g. don't use "text/plain" for "picture.png").

**Default:** "application/octet-stream"

ticketTextId.name: textId
ticketTextId.description: Unique identifier of a ticket text (ISGUID).

ticketLevel.name: level
ticketLevel.description: The highest ticket level represents the current state of a ticket. Previous levels represent the non  editable history. Each forward results in a new level.

serviceReportId.name: id
serviceReportId.description: Unique identifier of a service report.

assignmentId.name: assignmentId
assignmentId.description: Identifies a project assignment combined with *projectId*.
